If humans could see in the dark, it would revolutionize the way we live and work. We would no longer need artificial lighting, which would save a lot of energy and money. We could also explore dark environments like caves and underground tunnels more easily.

We would have a completely different understanding of the world around us. We would see things that we never saw before, like bioluminescent creatures and other natural phenomena. This could lead to new scientific discoveries and a deeper appreciation for the beauty of nature.

If we could see in the dark, we would be able to defend ourselves better in dangerous situations. We could see potential threats before they even realized we were there, which would give us an advantage in self-defense.
We would be able to travel more easily at night, without having to worry about getting lost or disoriented. This would make long-distance travel more accessible and efficient.

We would have to adapt to a new way of life, as our senses and perceptions would change. We would have to learn how to navigate in the dark and find new ways to communicate and interact with others. This could lead to new social and cultural developments.
